de.polygonal.ds.Collection

type
interface
A collection is an object that stores other objects (its elements), and that provides methods for accessing its elements.

Instance Methods

clear() : Void

Removes all elements from this collection. The result is an empty collection with size 0.

clone(assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

Duplicates the collection.
If assign is true the copier argument is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference. If assign is false and copier is null, the method assumes that all elements implement the Cloneable interface. In this case element.clone() is used for duplicating elements. Otherwise the method uses the specified copier function.
Example: 
	  class Foo implements de.polygonal.ds.Cloneable<Foo>
	  {
	    public function new() {}
	    public function clone():Foo { return new Foo(); }
	  }
	  ...
	  var c:Collection<Foo> = new ...<Foo>();

	  //create a 'shallow copy' (structure only)
	  var clone = c.clone(true);

	  //create a 'deep' copy (structure and elements) using element.clone()
	  var clone = c.clone(false);

	  //create a 'deep' copy using a function reference.
	  var clone = c.clone(false, function(existingValue:Foo) { return new Foo(); })

contains(x : T) : Bool

Returns true if this collection contains the element x.

isEmpty() : Bool

Returns true if this collection is empty.

iterator() : Iterator<T>

Iterates over all elements in this collection.
In HaXe the for-in syntax can be used:
	  var c:Collection<String> = new ...<String>(...);
	  for (element in c) trace(element);
In AS3 the hasNext() and next() methods of the iterator must be used: 
	  var c:Collection = new ...(...);
	  var itr:Object = c.iterator();
	  while (itr.hasNext())
	  {
	    var element:* = itr.next();
	    trace(element);
	  }
If an iterator object is frequently used, the performance can be improved by reusing it: 
	  var c:Collection<String> = new ...<String>(...);
	  var itr = c.iterator();
	  for (i in 0...100)
	  {
	    itr.reset();
	    for (element in itr) trace(element);
	  }

size() : Int

The total number of elements that the collection stores.

toArray(?output : Array<T>) : Array<T>

returns
The output array or a new array if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output array in the collection's natural order. Creates a new array if output is not specified.

toVector(?output : Vector<T>) : Vector<T>

returns
The output vector or a new vector if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output vector in the collection's natural order. Creates a new vector if output is not specified.
